metadata.dc:title: Incarcerated humerus fracture with radial palsy in a child: open reduction and percutaneous fixation technique. A case presentation and literature review
metadata.dc:creator: Campo, J
González-Onandía, P
García-Germán, D
Martínez, J
López, D
Fahandezh-Saddi, H
metadata.dc:description: Radial nerve palsy after humeral shaft fractures can be secondary to manipulation. Incorrect diagnosis of soft tissue entrapment can lead to repetitive manipulation, putting the radial nerve at risk. We present a case of humeral shaft fracture with soft tissue entrapment and secondary nerve palsy that was successfully managed with open reduction and percutaneous fixation. We discuss the correct management in these cases (AU)
metadata.dc:source: Rev. esp. cir. ortop. traumatol. (Ed. impr.);55(2): 120-124, mar.-abr.2011. ilus
metadata.dc:title: Fractura de húmero con interposición de partes blandas y paresia radial en un niño: técnica de reducción abierta y fijación percutánea. A propósito de un caso y revisión bibliográfica
